awd_abstract_narration: The Minnesota Zoological Garden will initiate a twelve-week,                    commuter Young Scholars project in behavioral research and                      conservation biology for 10 students entering grades 11,12.                                                                                                     Students will attend classes focusing on animal behavior,                       conservation biology, zoo biology and research methodology.                     Each student develops and executes an independent research study                with guidance from program senior staff and individual zoo staff                mentors.                                                                                                                                                        Students present their study findings through oral slide                        presentations to family, teachers, and zoo staff and also                       prepare research papers published in the Zooschool Journal.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
